dest_ip.description: Logical address of the intended receiver

dest_mac.description: Physical address of the intended receiver

opcode.description: Specifies the operation that the sender is performing

proto_type.description: Internetwork protocol for which the ARP request is intended

sshfp.description: A Secure Shell fingerprint, used to verify the system’s authenticity

SSHFP.description: A Secure Shell fingerprint is used to verify the system’s authenticity

grouped.desription: DNS fields grouped by type: alternative format, no direct keywords

queries.$comment: EVE DNS v3 style query logging.

rrname_truncated.description: Set to true if the rrname was too long and truncated by Suricata

query.$comment: EVE DNS v2 style query logging; as of Suricata 8 only used in DNS records when v2 logging is enabled, not used for DNS records logged as part of an event.

version.description: The version of this EVE DNS event

storing.description: the file is set to be stored when completed
the file is set to be stored when completed

exception_policy.description: The exception policy(ies) triggered by the flow. Not logged if none was triggered

host.$comment: May change to sensor_name in the future, or become user configurable: https://redmine.openinfosecfoundation.org/issues/4919

status_string.description: status string when it is not a valid integer (like 2XX)

ip_v.description: IP version of the packet or flow

type.description: Type of message, either a request or response

ndpi.description: nDPI plugin, contents provided by 3rd party library

linktype_name.description: the descriptive name of the linktype

password_redacted.description: indicates if a password message was received but not logged due to Suricata settings

row_count.description: Number of rows sent in CopyData messages

data_size.description: Accumulated data size of all CopyData messages sent

copy_column_count.description: Number of columns that will be copied in the CopyData message

command.description: a pop3 command, for example `USER` or `STAT`

cyu.description: ja3-like fingerprint for versions of QUIC before standardization

ja3.description: ja3 from client, as in TLS

ja3s.description: ja3 from server, as in TLS

ua.description: User Agent for versions of QUIC before standardization

attributes.description: A list of attributes to extend SDP

bandwidths.description: Proposed bandwidths to be used by the session or media

email.description: Email address for the person responsible for the conference

encryption_key.description: Field used to convey encryption keys if SDP is used over a secure channel

media_descriptions.description: A list of media descriptions for a session

attributes.description: A list of attributes specified for a media description

bandwidths.description: A list of bandwidth proposed for a media

encryption_key.description: Field used to convey encryption keys if SDP is used over a secure channel

media_info.description: Media information primarily intended for labelling media streams

phone_number.description: Phone number for the person responsible for the conference

time_descriptions.description: A list of time descriptions for a session

repeat_time.description: Specify repeat times for a session

time.description: Start and stop times for a session

timezone.description: Timezone to specify adjustments for times and offsets from the base time

uri.description: A pointer to additional information about the session

bittorrent-dht.description: Errors encountered parsing BitTorrent DHT protocol

krb5_tcp.description: Errors encountered parsing Kerberos v5/TCP protocol

krb5_udp.description: Errors encountered parsing Kerberos v5/UDP protocol

dns_udp.description: Number of flows for DNS/UDP protocol

failed_udp.description: Number of failed flows for UDP

ike.description: Number of flows for IKE protocol

nfs_tcp.description: Number of transactions for NFS/TCP protocol

nfs_udp.description: Number of transactions for NFS/UDP protocol

pgsql.description: Number of transactions for PostgreSQL protocol

quic.description: Number of transactions for QUIC protocol

rfb.description: Number of transactions for RFB protocol

sip_tcp.description: Number of transactions for SIP/TCP protocol

sip_udp.description: Number of transactions for SIP/UDP protocol

smb.description: Number of transactions for SMB protocol

ssh.description: Number of transactions for SSH protocol

telnet.description: Number of transactions for Telnet protocol

tls.description: Number of transactions for TLS protocol

trunc_pkt.description: Number of packets truncated by AF_PACKET

sll2.description: The number of times the SLL2 header was too small to be valid
The number of SLL2 frames encountered

max_frags_reached.description: How many times a fragment wasn't stored due to max-frags limit being reached

max_trackers_reached.description: How many times a packet wasn't reassembled due to max-trackers limit being reached

tracker_hard_reuse.description: Active tracker force closed before completion and reused for new tracker

tracker_soft_reuse.description: Finished tracker re-used from hash table before being moved to spare pool

blocked_function_errors.description: Counter for Lua scripts failing due to blocked functions being called

errors.description: Errors encountered while running Lua scripts

instruction_limit_errors.description: Count of Lua rules exceeding the instruction limit

memory_limit_errors.description: Count of Lua rules exceeding the memory limit

error.description: Consolidated stats on how many times app-layer error exception policy was applied, and which one

memcap.description: How many times defrag memcap exception policy was applied, and which one
How many times flow memcap exception policy was applied, and which one

midstream.description: How many times midstream exception policy was applied, and which one

ssn_memcap.description: How many times session memcap exception policy was applied, and which one

reassembly.description: How many times reassembly memcap exception policy was applied, and which one

emerg_mode_entered.description: Number of times emergency mode was entered

emerg_mode_over.description: Number of times recovery was made from emergency mode

get_used.description: Number of reused flows from the hash table in case memcap was reached and spare pool was empty

get_used_eval.description: Number of attempts at getting a flow directly from the hash

get_used_eval_busy.description: Number of times a flow was found in the hash but the lock for hash bucket could not be obtained

get_used_eval_reject.description: Number of flows that were evaluated but rejected from reuse as they were still alive/active

get_used_failed.description: Number of times retrieval of flow from hash was attempted but was unsuccessful

memcap.description: Number of times memcap was reached for flows

memuse.description: Memory currently in use by the flows

flows_checked.description: number of flows checked for timeout in the last pass

flows_evicted.description: number of flows that were evicted

flows_evicted_needs_work.description: number of TCP flows that were returned to the workers in case reassembly, detection, logging still needs work

flows_notimeout.description: number of flows that did not time out

flows_timeout.description: number of flows that reached the time out

full_hash_pass.description: number of times a full pass of the hash table was done

rows_maxlen.description: size of the biggest row in the hash table

rows_per_sec.description: number of rows to be scanned every second by a worker

queue_avg.description: average number of recycled flows per queue

queue_max.description: maximum number of recycled flows per queue

spare.description: Number of flows in the spare pool

tcp_reuse.description: Number of TCP flows that were reused as they seemed to share the same flow tuple

applayer_error.description: Number of packets dropped due to app-layer error exception policy

applayer_memcap.description: Number of packets dropped due to applayer memcap

decode_error.description: Number of packets dropped due to decoding errors

default_app_policy.description: Number of packets dropped due to default app policy

default_packet_policy.description: Number of packets dropped due to default packet policy

defrag_error.description: Number of packets dropped due to defragmentation errors

defrag_memcap.description: Number of packets dropped due to defrag memcap exception policy

flow_drop.description: Number of packets dropped due to dropped flows

flow_memcap.description: Number of packets dropped due to flow memcap exception policy

nfq_error.description: Number of packets dropped due to no NFQ verdict

rules.description: Number of packets dropped due to rule actions

stream_error.description: Number of packets dropped due to invalid TCP stream

stream_memcap.description: Number of packets dropped due to stream memcap exception policy

stream_midstream.description: Number of packets dropped due to stream midstream exception policy

stream_reassembly.description: Number of packets dropped due to stream reassembly exception policy

stream_urgent.description: Number of packets dropped due to TCP urgent flag

threshold_detection_filter.description: Number of packets dropped due to threshold detection filter

tunnel_packet_drop.description: Number of packets dropped due to inner tunnel packet being dropped

drop_reason.description: Number of dropped packets, grouped by drop reason

pressure.description: Percentage of memcaps used by flow, stream, stream-reassembly and app-layer-http

pressure_max.description: Maximum pressure seen by the engine

filtered_bpf.description: Number of packets filtered out by bpf (not written)

urg.description: Number of TCP packets with the urgent flag set

urgent_oob_data.description: Number of OOB bytes tracked in TCP urgent handling

tc_urgent_oob_data.description: Number of Out-of-Band bytes sent by server using TCP urgent packets

ts_urgent_oob_data.description: Number of Out-of-Band bytes sent by client using TCP urgent packets

tx_guessed.description: the signature that triggered this alert didn't tie to a transaction, so the transaction (and metadata) logged is a forced estimation and may not be the one you expect

mname_truncated.description: Set to true if the mname was too long and truncated by Suricata

rdata_truncated.description: Set to true if the rdata was too long and truncated by Suricata

rrname_truncated.description: Set to true if the rrname was too long and truncated by Suricata

exception_policy.description: How many times app-layer error exception policy was applied, and which one

parser.description: Number of errors reported by parser
